mission.title: Our Mission
mission.p1: ServerFlow was born from a simple frustration: deploying code shouldn't require a PhD in DevOps. As AI coding assistants like Claude and Cursor become more powerful, the gap between "code that works locally" and "code running in production" is becoming the biggest bottleneck.
mission.p2: We believe deployment should be as simple as talking to your AI assistant. Say "deploy to production" and watch it happen. No YAML files. No CI/CD configuration. No SSH tunnels. Just ship.

zeroTrust.description: We built ServerFlow so we literally cannot access your servers. Your keys stay on your infrastructure. Period.

simplicity.title: Simplicity Over Features
simplicity.description: We'd rather do 10 things perfectly than 100 things poorly. Every feature must make deployment simpler, not more complex.

hero.title: Security
hero.subtitle: Zero-Trust security is not a feature. It's our architecture.

intro.title: We Can't Access Your Servers
intro.subtitle: Most platforms store your SSH keys and "promise" not to look. We took a different approach: we literally cannot access your servers. Here's how.
intro.zeroTrustExplainer: Imagine even if someone has the key to your house, you verify their identity at every interior door. ServerFlow never trusts by default: every command must be signed and verified, and no connection is allowed from outside to your server.

ed25519.title: Ed25519 Cryptographic Signatures
ed25519.description: Every command sent through ServerFlow is cryptographically signed using Ed25519, the same elliptic curve cryptography used by Signal, OpenSSH, and TLS 1.3. This mathematically guarantees that commands cannot be forged or tampered with.

outbound.title: Outbound-Only Connections
outbound.description: The ServerFlow agent on your server initiates all connections to our orchestrator. We never connect to your server.
points: No SSH keys to manage or leak
No open ports required on your firewall
No way for us to access your server directly

zeroStorage.title: No Server Access Keys
zeroStorage.description: We never store SSH keys or root passwords. Service credentials (MySQL, Redis) are generated locally on your server and transit encrypted once to your dashboard. We cannot use them to access your machines.

openSource.title: Open Source Agent
openSource.description: Our agent is 100% open source. You can audit every line of code that runs on your server. We encourage security researchers to review our code.

dataPrivacy.title: Data Privacy
dataPrivacy.description: ServerFlow processes deployment commands, logs, and service connection strings (displayed once in your dashboard). We never access your application code, database contents, or user data. All transmissions are encrypted with TLS 1.3.

diagram.title: How It Works
diagram.details: NO SSH â€¢ NO OPEN PORTS â€¢ YOUR DATA STAYS YOURS

infoBox.defaultText: Hover over the diagram elements to understand our Zero-Trust architecture and the security protocols used (Ed25519, TLS 1.3).
infoBox.vpsText: The ServerFlow agent is a sentinel. It uses the Ed25519 cryptographic standard to prove its identity. Unlike traditional methods, your private keys NEVER leave your server.
infoBox.sfText: Our platform acts as a secure command center. It never "enters" your home. It prepares signed instructions that only your agent can decrypt and execute via a TLS 1.3 tunnel (the highest current standard).
infoBox.pipeText: The "pipe" is a persistent outbound connection. The agent initiates contact. This guarantees that no hacker can scan or attack open ports on your server: there are none.
